DataElement.preferredName: Medication Addendum Question During Delayed Period Take Any Medication Except the Study Drug for Nausea Take Any Medication Except the Study Drug Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of the reason they took a medication for nausea, other than the study drug, on the second day during the first week of chemotherapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Medication Addendum Question During Delayed Period Take Any Medication Except the Study Drug for Nausea
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The sensation that one is about to vomit._The reflex act of ejecting the contents of the stomach through the mouth._An appendage to an existing document that contains supplemental information. The parent document remains content is unaltered._Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument._Nausea and vomiting occurring more than 24 hours following chemotherapy._A question about whether an individual took any medication, except the study drug, for nausea during the specified time period.
